greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n - 1 - phi(n).
comment: Apart from the first term, the same as A016035.
For n > 1, a(n) is also the number of numbers below n which are not coprime to n.
x^(n - 1 - phi(n)) is congruent to x^(n - 1) mod n, if x is coprime to n, since x^phi(n) is congruent to 1 (mod n) if x is coprime to n.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = n - 1 - A000010(n) = A051953(n) - 1 = cototient(n) - 1. - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 21 2012
results.author: _V. Raman_, Nov 20 2012
